metadata.title: CVE-2024-26816 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:x86, relocs: Ignore relocations in .notes sectionWhen building with CONFIG_XEN_PV=y, .text symbols are emitted intothe .notes section so that Xen can find the "startup_xen" entry point.This information is used prior to booting the kernel, so relocationsare not useful. In fact, performing relocations against the .notessection means that the KASLR base is exposed since /sys/kernel/notesis world-readable.To avoid leaking the KASLR base without breaking unprivileged tools thatare expecting to read /sys/kernel/notes, skip performing relocations inthe .notes section. The values readable in .notes are then identical tothose found in System.map.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
